ch.phonon

Class ResourceLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.phonon.ResourceLoader

  • public class ResourceLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    The ResourceLoader class is the central utility class collecting functions that are relevant for loading resources as pictures, videos and sounds. The class also allows loading of jar-internal resources, that are provided by the application. The class is associated by the notation of standard folders used by the applications. Pictures can be found in the pics folder of the tar file, while sounds can be found in the sounds folder.
    Author:
    phonon

      • getAudioStreamFromResource

        public static javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream getAudioStreamFromResource(java.lang.String resource)
        Get an reset and reusable AudioInputStream by file name reference from the standard resourceBundle.properties file (found in the ./config folder)
        Parameters:
        resource - property name containing the filename of the sound file to be loaded into the AudioInputStream.
        Returns:
        AudioInputStream containing the sound to played by e.g. in an Sound object.

      • getResource

        public static java.lang.String getResource(java.lang.String baseName)
        For the whole Application a general properties file is arranged. It can be found at path ch.phonon.config.resourceBundleProperties. Properties stored in this file adjust various thinks like menu names, view colors etc. Any property is keyed by baseName. The value of the property is returned as string.
        Parameters:
        baseName -
        Returns:
        a string of the property value

      • getStandardInputStreams

        public static java.util.EnumMap<SoundType,javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream> getStandardInputStreams()
        Load the standard sound AudioInputStreams by the file names found in the resourceBundle.properties file (found in the ./condig folder) into an EnumMap. The contract of standard sounds is defined by the SoundType enum, that's items directly reflect the property name in the resourceBundle file. The obtained map can direclty be used e.g. by the Sound.setStandardStreams(EnumMap)
        Returns:
        EnumMap containing the AudioInputStreams

      • getUrl

        public static java.net.URL getUrl(java.lang.String path)
        This convinience function is used to obtain resource paths directly in the jar file of the application.
        Parameters:
        path -
        Returns:
        URL of the path
